info.title: NetSuite REST Record API
info.description: NetSuite REST Record API generated 2024-05-24 at 11:18:03 UTC for account TSTDRV1303059, user joe.klug@peregrineconnect.com with role Neuron ESB Integration.

parameters.name: Prefer
parameters.description: The server behavior requested by the client. Use 'respond-async' to execute the request asynchronously. If the request is executed asynchronously, 'Preference-applied: respond-async' is returned in the response.

parameters.name: X-NetSuite-Idempotency-Key
parameters.description: A user-defined unique idempotency key that is applied to every asynchronous requests to ensure that the request is executed only once. Only one request can be executed with every unique idempotency key. Use UUID in string format as defined by RFC 4122. If the request is executed synchronously, this value is ignored.

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: The search query that is used to filter results.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The limit used to specify the number of results on a single page.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The offset used for selecting a specific page of results.

parameters.name: Prefer
parameters.description: The server behavior requested by the client. Use 'respond-async' to execute the request asynchronously. If the request is executed asynchronously, 'Preference-applied: respond-async' is returned in the response.

parameters.name: X-NetSuite-Idempotency-Key
parameters.description: A user-defined unique idempotency key that is applied to every asynchronous requests to ensure that the request is executed only once. Only one request can be executed with every unique idempotency key. Use UUID in string format as defined by RFC 4122. If the request is executed synchronously, this value is ignored.

parameters.name: replace
parameters.description: The names of sublists on this record. All sublist lines will be replaced with lines specified in the request. The names are delimited by comma.

parameters.name: X-NetSuite-PropertyNameValidation
parameters.description: Sets the strictness of property name validation.

parameters.name: X-NetSuite-PropertyValueValidation
parameters.description: Sets the strictness of property value validation.

X-NetSuite-PropertyValidation.description: The description of a property validation failure.

X-NetSuite-Warning.description: Warning messages that occurred during processing.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Internal identifier.

parameters.name: expandSubResources
parameters.description: Set to 'true' to automatically expand all sublists, sublist lines, and subrecords on this record.

parameters.name: simpleEnumFormat
parameters.description: Set to true to return enumeration values in a format that only shows the internal ID value.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: The names of the fields and sublists on the record. Only the selected fields and sublists will be returned in the response.

X-NetSuite-Warning.description: Warning messages that occurred during processing.

parameters.name: replaceSelectedFields
parameters.description: If set to 'true', all fields that should be deleted in the update request, including body fields, must be included in the 'replace' query parameter.

type.title: Type
type.description: A URI reference to the documentation about the problem type.

title.title: Title
title.description: A human-readable description of the problem type.

status.title: Status
status.description: The HTTP status code generated by the server the request originates from.

o:errorDetails.description: An array containing one or more problem types.

detail.title: Detail
detail.description: A detailed, human-readable description of the problem occurrence.

o:errorPath.title: Error Path
o:errorPath.description: The JSON path that indicates where the problem occurs within the request body.

o:errorUrl.title: Error URL
o:errorUrl.description: The URI of the first element in the request URL where the problem occurs.

o:errorHeader.title: Error Header
o:errorHeader.description: The name of the HTTP header where the problem occurs.

o:errorQueryParam.title: Error Query Parameter
o:errorQueryParam.description: The name of the query parameter where the problem occurs.

o:errorCode.title: Error Code
o:errorCode.description: The application-specific error code. Similar problem types are grouped together.

zip.title: Zip
zip.description: Enter the postal code the way it should appear on all forms except checks.

addr2.title: Address 2
addr2.description: Enter an optional second address line the way it should appear on forms. For employees, customers, partners, and vendors, what you enter here autofills on forms if this address is marked default for Shipping or Billing. Enter up to 50 characters.

city.title: City
city.description: Enter the city the way it should appear on all forms except checks.

addr1.title: Address 1
addr1.description: Enter the address the way it should appear on forms. For employees, customers, partners, and vendors, what you enter here autofills on forms if this address is marked default for Shipping or Billing. Enter up to 50 characters. This field is required for the Online Bill Pay feature.

addressee.title: Addressee
addressee.description: Enter the name of the entity that should appear on the shipping label here. This name appears on the shipping label below what you enter in the Attention field.

attention.title: Attention
attention.description: Enter the name of the person to whom a shipment is addressed, as it should appear on shipping labels. This field is required for UPS Integration.

override.title: Override
override.description: Check this box to disable the free-form address text field. When this field is disabled, text entered in the other address fields does not display in the Address text field. Clear this box to allow text entered in the address component fields to appear in the free-form address text field.

state.title: State/Province
state.description: Enter your company's state or province the way it should appear on all forms except checks.

addrText.title: Address
addrText.description: The values entered in the other address fields are displayed here.

zip.title: Zip
zip.description: Enter the postal code the way it should appear on all forms except checks.

addr2.title: Address 2
addr2.description: Enter an optional second address line the way it should appear on forms. For employees, customers, partners, and vendors, what you enter here autofills on forms if this address is marked default for Shipping or Billing. Enter up to 50 characters.

city.title: City
city.description: Enter the city the way it should appear on all forms except checks.

addr1.title: Address 1
addr1.description: Enter the address the way it should appear on forms. For employees, customers, partners, and vendors, what you enter here autofills on forms if this address is marked default for Shipping or Billing. Enter up to 50 characters. This field is required for the Online Bill Pay feature.

addressee.title: Addressee
addressee.description: Enter the name of the entity that should appear on the shipping label here. This name appears on the shipping label below what you enter in the Attention field.

attention.title: Attention
attention.description: Enter the name of the person to whom a shipment is addressed, as it should appear on shipping labels. This field is required for UPS Integration.

override.title: Override
override.description: Check this box to disable the free-form address text field. When this field is disabled, text entered in the other address fields does not display in the Address text field. Clear this box to allow text entered in the address component fields to appear in the free-form address text field.

state.title: State/Province
state.description: Enter your company's state or province the way it should appear on all forms except checks.

addrText.title: Address
addrText.description: The values entered in the other address fields are displayed here.

tranDate.title: Date
tranDate.description: NetSuite inserts today's date for the posting date of this estimate. You can type or pick another date. What you enter here determines the date range in which this transaction appears on the estimate registers. You can select or enter custom date ranges on registers.

memo.title: Memo
memo.description: If you wish, enter a memo to describe this estimate. It will appear on reports such as the 2-line Estimates register that your customers can see if you give them permission to log in and view their transaction history.

startDate.title: Start Date
startDate.description: If there is an expected closing date for this estimate, accept today's date or enter a new date here.

probability.title: Probability (%)
probability.description: Accept or change the probability that this estimate will be converted to a sale. The Probability field shows the probability of the status selected. If this estimate is for a prospect, the prospect's record is updated with what is entered here. To change the default probability of a status, go to Setup > Sales > Customer Statuses, and click the status you want to change.

handlingCost.title: Handling Cost
handlingCost.description: The handling cost automatically calculates depending on the shipping method you select in the Ship Via field. To change the cost of handling, go to Lists > Accounting > Shipping Items and select the shipping method with the handling cost you want to change.

billAddress.title: Bill To
billAddress.description: The default billing address autofills this field from the customer's record at Lists > Relationships > Customers. To enter a different address: * Select another address in the Bill To Select field. * Select New in the Bill To Select field to enter a new billing address.

endDate.title: End Date
endDate.description: Enter or pick the end date for this estimate.

subtotal.title: Subtotal
subtotal.description: This field shows the total of the items on this sales order. This is the total before any discounts, shipping cost, handling cost or tax is added to the order.

shippingCost.title: Shipping Cost
shippingCost.description: The shipping cost automatically calculates depending on the shipping method you select in the Ship Via field. If this field reads ReCalc, click the Recalculate Shipping button to receive a shipping cost. If you use UPS Real-Time rates and a package is over 150lbs, the package is charged as multiple packages equal to or less than 150lbs.

includeInForecast.title: Include In Forecast
includeInForecast.description: Check this box to include this estimate in sales forecast reports, key performance indicators and snapshots. If this estimate has a probability below the min. probability you set at Setup > Set Up SFA > Forecasts, it will not appear on reports, key performance indicators and snapshots. If you use NetSuite or NetCRM and this estimate was created from an opportunity, checking this box removes the opportunity from the sales forecast. Clearing this box includes the opportunity instead.

visibleToCustomer.title: Available In Customer Center
visibleToCustomer.description: Check the Available in Customer Center box to make this estimate available to customers in the Customer Center. Clear this box to leave this estimate off the list of estimates available to customers in the Customer Center. This field is checked by default.

custbody_sii_not_reported_in_time.title: Billing Record Cannot Be Submitted On Time

discountRate.title: Rate
discountRate.description: NetSuite enters the rate for the discount item you selected. You can change the discount rate for this cash refund. Enter the discount as a dollar amount like 10.00, or as a percentage like 10%.

altHandlingCost.title: Handling Cost
altHandlingCost.description: The handling cost automatically calculates depending on the shipping method you select in the Ship Via field. To change the cost of handling, go to Lists > Shipping Items and select the shipping method with the handling cost you want to change.

shipAddress.title: Ship To
shipAddress.description: The default shipping address autofills this field from the customer's record at Lists > Customers. To enter a different address: * Select another address in the Ship To Select field. * Select New in the Ship To Select field to enter a new billing address.

toBePrinted.title: To Be Printed
toBePrinted.description: Check this box if you wish to save this in a queue of estimates to print. Otherwise, you can click Print below to submit and print this estimate at once.

discountTotal.title: Discount Total
discountTotal.description: NetSuite enters the amount discounted on this estimate. If this discount item is taxable, the discount is applied before taxes. If it is not taxable, the discount is applied after taxes.

toBeEmailed.title: To Be Emailed
toBeEmailed.description: Check this box if you want to email this estimate. Then enter the email address in the space to the right of the check box. You can enter multiple email addresses by separating them with semicolons. It is important to separate the addresses with only semicolons, and do not include any spaces.

trackingNumbers.title: Tracking Numbers
trackingNumbers.description: Enter the shipment tracking number from the shipping company. If a tracking number is entered in the exact format used by UPS or FedEx and the transaction is saved, the tracking number will show on the transaction as a link to the UPS or FedEx website. You can click the link to check the status of the shipment.

fob.title: FOB
fob.description: Enter the location where the customers technically acquire ownership. For example, if your customers own goods as soon as they ship and pay the shipping costs from your location to theirs, you might enter Our warehouse.

custbody_doc_num_summ_invoice.title: Last Document Number Of Summary Invoice

otherRefNum.title: PO/Check Number
otherRefNum.description: If a purchase order number applies to this estimate, enter it here.

exchangeRate.title: Exchange Rate
exchangeRate.description: The currency's exchange rate is shown in this field. You can edit the exchange rate for this transaction only, or you can update the currency record with the exchange rate you enter here.

title.title: Title
title.description: Enter a title for this estimate. The estimate title text appears on lists, shows in search and reporting results, and shows on the Estimates subtab of records it is associated with. When an estimate is converted from an opportunity, the title from the opportunity defaults into the title field on the estimate. If there is already an estimate against the opportunity, then the second estimate has a number following the title. For example, if the first estimate title is “Project Estimate”, then the second estimate title is “Project Estimate1”. For each subsequent estimate created against that opportunity, the number in the title increases by 1 to help distinguish between multiple estimates associated to a single opportunity. The estimate title field is also available for customization, direct list editing, and mass updates.

toBeFaxed.title: To Be Faxed
toBeFaxed.description: Check this box if you want to fax this estimate. Enter the fax number in the space to the right of the check box if it doesn't already appear. To fax NetSuite forms, an administrator must first set up fax service at Setup > Company > Printing, Fax and Email Preferences.

total.title: Total
total.description: NetSuite computes the total of line items and tax and then enters it here.

expectedCloseDate.title: Expected Close Date
expectedCloseDate.description: Enter the date you expect this estimate to close.

shipDate.title: Ship Date
shipDate.description: Enter, pick or accept the date you expect to ship items ordered.

tranId.title: Estimate #
tranId.description: NetSuite increases the largest estimate number by one. If you wish, you can type another number. The next estimate number will revert to the standard pattern.

message.title: Client Message
message.description: The text of the customer message you select in the Select Message field appears here. You can edit the message or enter a new customer message for only this transaction.

altSalesTotal.title: Alt. Sales Total
altSalesTotal.description: The alternate sales amount total is shown here.

dueDate.title: Due Date
dueDate.description: Type or pick a date this estimate expires.

altShippingCost.title: Shipping Cost
altShippingCost.description: The shipping cost automatically calculates depending on the shipping method you select in the Ship Via field above. To change the cost of a shipping method, go to Lists > Accounting > Shipping Items and select the shipping method you want to change. If you use UPS Real-Time rates, shipments over 150lbs are broken up into shipments less than or equal to 150lbs for charging.

items.title: Items
items.description: An array field that represents a collection of elements, for example, sublist lines, multiselect items, or search results.
